Jack Harper.Action: Looks at himself in the mirror with curious, kind, almost child-like eyes.
Shares a close, affectionate morning routine with Victoria, including a kiss on the top of her head.
Keeps a photo of himself and Victoria smiling and eager, indicating sentimental value and emotional connection.
Wakes up calmly, follows a familiar morning routine showing discipline and self-care.
Pauses to look at a photo of himself and Victoria from younger days, showing a moment of reflection but then proceeds to work.
Moves confidently to his futuristic bubble ship and climbs in without hesitation.
Engages with Victoria in friendly banter, joking about the bobblehead and inviting her to join the ride.
Touches a few controls un-phased by the extreme drop speed.
Confirms receipt of five Resource Gatherer coordinates promptly and confidently.
Monitors multiple instruments and screens including environmental and cam footage simultaneously.
Responds casually with 'Same ole' same' to Victoria, showing relaxed confidence.
Hums an upbeat, hopeful song ('I've got sunshine on a cloudy day') while struggling with dangerous flying conditions.
Shows determination and a bit of levity under pressure, working to regain control to protect both himself and Victoria.
Moments of silent marvel at the beautiful, desolate planet despite stressful circumstances.
Takes control of the Bubbleship in dangerous weather using instruments despite loss of visual, works the controls skillfully to regain stability.
Smacks a panel with his fist to jolt the ship back to power and control, showing both frustration and practical problem-solving.
Continues humming/singing while struggling to regain control, suggesting calmness under pressure and confidence.
Shares a small smile and engages in casual banter about a sports game, showing familiarity and lightheartedness.
Shows focused and professional demeanor while piloting the ship and coordinating with Victoria, without notable friendliness or empathy.
Takes control of the Bubbleship confidently, aggressively pushing the ship to the limit despite warnings about fuel.
Successfully navigates the ship through a huge crater, narrowly missing the edge and maintaining control.
Demonstrates knowledge of the fallen drone and its surroundings, recalling details about Giants Stadium, showing awareness and intelligence.
Dismisses Victoria's suggestion to reserve fuel with a confident refusal and a small smile, indicating self-assurance.
Puts on weapon, checks its charge before leaving the ship to approach the downed drone under uncertain and dangerous environmental conditions.
Moves toward the target despite lack of support and lack of visual coverage from Tet, showing confidence and situational awareness.
Pauses and listens carefully to faint environmental sounds (a whine on the wind), indicating alertness and attention to detail.
Asks for help in repairing the drone, cooperates with Victoria and Bob, and communicates clearly about the situation.
Focuses on technical repair under threat but does not show friendly or interpersonal warmth explicitly in this excerpt.
Expertly locates the missing fuel-cell on the drone and begins field repair under pressure.
Keeps situational awareness by asking for backup and watching his back while repairing the drone.
Ignores Victoria's urgent advice to get out quickly, choosing to continue repairs on site.
Uses chewing gum to fix a critical system under pressure, enabling the drone to power up.
Imagines a cheering crowd and plays along to lift spirits despite the bleak reality.
Hears the whimpering of an animal and hesitates, showing empathy and concern.
Improvises a repair using chewing gum on a critical system, successfully restoring function as indicated by systems going green on Victoria's console.
Quickly identifies and slots the deuterium fuel cell delivered by the Rover, powering up the drone efficiently.
Pauses and shows hesitation before opening the fuel cell door again, indicating internal conflict and caution rather than rash action.
Responds to auditory cues (animal whimper) and investigates carefully down the tunnel, showing situational awareness and thoughtful approach.
Approaches a starving, shivering dog calmly and speaks gently to it.
Runs away from a threatening bear to save himself without attempting to help the dog or confront the threat further.
Recognizes danger quickly and sprints away from the giant bear pursuing him.
Despite stumbling and sliding before reaching the drone, he manages to shut the fuel cell door, reactivating the drone which then saves him by attacking the bear.
Approaches a starving, scared dog gently and tries to calm it before the danger appears, showing emotional intelligence and caution.
Initially misjudges the environment by getting too close to a huge dangerous animal which surprises him and causes him to panic and flee.
Jack averts his gaze and breathes hard as the drone scans him, indicating discomfort but no decisive action, showing a momentary hesitation or lack of control.
Offers to pick up groceries for Victoria (milk, bread) despite his fatigue.
Responds with tired smile when Victoria expresses care and concern.
Dismisses Victoria's plea to come home and stay safe, choosing curiosity over her wishes.
Photographs the devastated landscape and resource harvester to preserve history for future generations on Mars.
Questions the necessity of taking all resources, showing concern about the impact on the environment.
Ignores Victoria's advice to stop searching without a drone signal and insists on continuing.
Scans the horizon thoroughly with binoculars and photographs the huge resource gatherer for future reference, demonstrating foresight and careful observation.
Questions the extent of resource harvesting ('Do we have to take it all?'), showing thoughtful consideration of the situation rather than blind compliance.
Notices a glint on the horizon and zooms in with binoculars despite unclear visibility, showing alertness and attention to detail.
Ignores Victoria's dismissal of his search for a signal without confirmation, indicating persistence but possibly bordering on stubbornness.
Acknowledges and begins repair on a gyro issue proactively, indicating technical skill and ability to address problems confidently.
Transforms a rectangular case into a full unfolding motorcycle quickly and expertly, highlighting practical skill and resourcefulness.
Enjoys riding the bike carefree and alone, showing a relaxed and sincere side.
Drops a flare into the sink hole to investigate the drone thoughtfully, showing care and thoroughness.
Examines the wrecked drone with marvel and focus, indicating a respectful and attentive nature.
Cautiously searches for the missing fuel cell, shows concern and alertness to danger (raises flare to illuminate pit).
Carefully slides fuel cell door open to check for fuel cell despite earlier damage, showing attention to detail.
Quickly reacts to sudden movement and draws gun fluidly, demonstrating alertness and readiness.
Identifies the drone trap by observing the twisted chain-mesh and cables overhead, displaying situational awareness.
Steps forward without immediately noticing the giant hole in the floor and almost falls in, indicating a lapse in situational caution.
Cuts loose the claw trapping his leg with decisive, ruthless action.
Fires into the darkness at something causing inhuman screams, showing no hesitation or mercy.
Blows dust off an old book with a moment of admiration, suggesting appreciation and curiosity.
Balances carefully on a narrow bent girder under a precarious wreckage, recognizing the danger and choosing not to disturb it.
Successfully uses a laser cutter on his cuff to slice through a rapidly tightening cable trap under extreme pressure.
Responds immediately by firing his rifle into the darkness to fend off an unknown, aggressive creature advancing on him.
Cuts loose his claw rapidly and retreats while under attack, maintaining situational awareness and tactical withdrawal.
Leaps across a dangerous gap as the girder in front of him is pulled away, demonstrates agility and quick decision-making.
Hangs momentarily in midair after his jump, then hauls himself up with determination despite the risk.
Clips into a line and uses his suit’s automatic ascender to escape rapidly from alien pursuers.
Does not anticipate or prevent the knife cut to his ascender line, leading to a dangerous situation while ascending.
Frustrated outburst upon discovering his bike stolen, curses at his pain and situation.
Unarmed and injured, continues onward despite harsh conditions.
Recovers from a fall and quickly assesses the situation as a drone arrives and eliminates threats.
Is frustrated and angry when he finds his bike taken, but perseveres despite injury to start walking through harsh weather.
Says goodnight warmly and consistently to colleagues, indicating a friendly routine.
Shares a tense but acknowledging nod with Victoria upon returning, showing mutual respect and connection.
Remembers affectionate moments with Victoria, brushing hair from her face, indicating care and tenderness.
Closes eyes under warm shower, showing vulnerability but no social engagement, somewhat neutral.
Distance implied in memory snap to a brunette woman, possibly indicating emotional confusion or conflict.
Reorients the Bubbleship canopy controls to face away from travel direction, indicating situational awareness and control of technology.
Punches the throttle and effectively pilots the Bubbleship through the clouds, demonstrating skill and confidence.
Responds to Victoria's tense welcome with a calm nod, showing emotional control in a stressful environment.
Closes eyes under shower steam, allowing memories and distractions to surface, suggesting a momentary lapse in focus.
Kisses Victoria on the head in a quiet affectionate moment.
Pauses thoughtfully looking at a photo of younger self and Victoria, reflecting on past innocence and eagerness.
Shows respect to Victoria's wishes about not bringing surface items into the house and waits patiently.
Carefully gathers supplies needed for a long tour, indicating thorough preparation.
Pauses thoughtfully at a photo of his younger self, showing reflection and awareness of past innocence.
Inspects new arriving disabled drone, showing attention to detail and awareness of potential danger.
Puts a book into a drawer rather than reading it, indicating possible avoidance or lack of engagement with further learning.
Brings a surface item into the living area despite rules, then accepts correction and adjusts behavior.
Demonstrates patient and calm demeanor in conversation with Victoria, supporting teamwork.
Brings Victoria a small green seedling as a gift, watches her reaction with pleasure.
Chuckles after Victoria expresses concern over the plant potentially being toxic, seeming dismissive of her worries.
Admits to being hurt with a glance but offers no explanation, allowing Victoria to examine and treat his wound.
Allows Victoria to treat his painful wound without complaint.
Engages in a calm, understanding conversation with Victoria about their differences and responsibilities.
Expresses desire to enjoy the world before it ends, showing sensitivity to broader consequences.
Shows resistance to simply fulfilling his assigned role and duties, implying a need for personal authenticity.
Puts his arms around Victoria, responds with gentle physical affection after she expresses concern.
Uses humor to lighten tense moment by joking about looking tasty after being attacked.
Puts a finger to Victoria’s lips and kisses her to calm her.
Considered Victoria’s concern seriously before responding.
Engages in intimate behavior (removing shirt, inviting Victoria) despite the tension, showing closeness and trust.
Kisses Victoria and shares a playful moment stealing wine, showing lighthearted intimacy and connection.
Withdraws slightly when Victoria toasts their survival, suggesting some emotional reserve.
Makes self-deprecating joke about job (overhauling toilets) to keep mood light.
Calmly jokes about a dangerous encounter, tries to lighten the mood despite recent threat.
Seems evasive or noncommittal when Victoria directly questions the risk to himself and her.
Engages in affectionate and intimate interaction amid tension, indicating emotional intelligence and confidence.
Appears distracted or emotionally withdrawn when Victoria toasts their survival.
Playfully pulls Victoria into the pool, leading to laughter and closeness.
Wakes troubled and silently leaves Victoria sleeping, showing restraint and respect for her rest.
Calmly reacts to an unexpected accident (the wine glass falling) without panic, showing presence of mind.
Playfully pulls Victoria into the pool and engages in lighthearted interaction, showing confidence and social ease.
Wakes troubled by a dream and quietly leaves without disturbing Victoria, demonstrating self-control and emotional intelligence.
Kisses Victoria tenderly on dawn; shows gentle, affectionate behavior.
Reads a book quietly, appears strangely troubled, indicating introspection but no overt interaction.
Carefully collects and keeps various found objects, including a book, indicating attention to detail and methodical behavior.
Reads 'The Education of Henry Adams' attentively, showing intellectual curiosity and deliberate self-education.
Appears troubled after reading, suggesting reflective thinking and awareness of inner conflict, which can indicate cognitive competence.
Kisses Victoria before going off to work, showing a moment of affection.
Dismisses Victoria's concern about going out without a signal, focusing on his own need to be in the field.
Engages in playful conversation with his bobblehead, showing lightheartedness.
Confidently suits up and starts the complex bubbleship startup procedure, demonstrating familiarity and control over advanced technology.
Takes initiative to pilot the bubbleship manually despite caution from Victoria, showing willingness to assume responsibility and skill.
Acknowledges the risk involved but chooses to act anyway, showing decisiveness but potentially recklessness.
Reassures Victoria by telling her 'Don't be embarrassed, there's always a first time,' showing understanding and encouragement.
Responds promptly and offers to investigate the rogue signal, showing willingness to help and responsibility.
Confidently volunteers to investigate an unknown and potentially dangerous rogue signal despite uncertainty.
Skillfully pilots his ship up a challenging waterfall to reach a concealed location.
Shows calmness and a measured attitude when facing uncertainty ('Don't be embarrassed, there's always a first time').
Identifies and traces a hidden wire linked to car batteries under rubbish.
Climbs arduously to discover a transmitter hooked to old military equipment atop a damaged antenna.
Analyzes signal frequency using heads-up display and understands the old radio system is reactivated.
Severs the lines to kill the signal instead of blowing up the Empire State structure as initially planned.
Pauses and seems troubled, watching the Observation Deck as the ship lifts off.
Pilots the ship intensely to avoid radiation despite the danger.
Pauses setting charges and instead severs the signal lines directly, showing adaptability and decisive action.
Pilots the Bubbleship carefully, noticing drone traps and hazardous territories, demonstrating situational awareness and skill.
Minimizes the danger of radiation exposure and continues approaching hazardous conditions, displaying some recklessness or overconfidence.
Steers into a steep canyon confidently, demonstrating familiarity with difficult terrain.
Maintains a secret place with a carefully constructed grotto and extensive gear, showing resourcefulness and long-term planning.
Uses a solar generator and manages electronic equipment like a military jammer, indicating technical skill and adaptability.
His ship is absent from the control station's map, suggesting deliberate stealth or evasion.
Sits alone by the lake, carefully brings and opens books, displaying a reflective and sensitive side.
Plays basketball alone with a robot retrieving the ball, suggesting solitude and lack of social interaction.
Sets up a basketball hoop with the Rover to retrieve balls, showing resourcefulness and use of technology for training.
Sits alone by the water meticulously reading books, indicating a thoughtful and deliberate approach.
Appears in an obscure state of frustration and closes books unsatisfied, which may indicate a moment of doubt or less effective mental state.
Tries to communicate a difficult decision gently to the Rover, shows hesitation and sadness.
Lies back on the bank, showing silent emotional struggle instead of lashing out or shutting down.
Takes a moment to reflect deeply, considers emotional and practical aspects before making a decision about staying or leaving; tries to communicate thoughtfully with the Rover despite its confusion.
Lies back and closes his eyes after stating 'I should stay', suggesting hesitation or emotional vulnerability rather than immediate action.
Scrambles to act quickly after seeing the shuttle crash, immediately preparing to investigate despite personal risk.
Does not explain whereabouts honestly to Victoria, remains silent instead of lying outright.
Expresses concern about drones killing anything that moves, showing empathy towards life forms.
Remembers something desperate upon waking suddenly from a nightmare.
Quickly reacts to the meteor/shuttle crash by grabbing binoculars, identifying the crash location, and immediately boarding and piloting the Bubbleship.
Sets a course confidently towards the smoke on the horizon indicating the crash site.
Does not immediately lie to Victoria about his whereabouts, showing honesty even when it might be difficult.
Questions Victoria's assessment of the crashed ship being alien and offers his own observation (uncertainty about it being alien).
Insists on not relying solely on the Drones because they will 'kill anything that moves,' implying he might intervene personally despite the orders.
Disobeys Victoria's orders repeatedly to turn around, insisting on investigating the crash site himself.
Refuses to follow Victoria's direct order to turn around and instead insists on investigating the crash site himself.
Confidently identifies the wreckage as one of their own, specifically an old pre-war NASA shuttle.
Touches down and exits his ship before it has fully settled, showing decisiveness and readiness.
Silent and unsure when first given a direct order to wait, indicating momentary hesitation.
Risking his own safety by entering burning wreckage to search for survivors.
Shows emotional reaction and concern upon finding the woman from his dreams alive in a pod.
Voices alarm and protest as drones fire on the ship and pods, showing protective instincts.
Touches down from his Bubbleship before it's settled and immediately heads into burning wreckage despite searing heat and disorientation.
Moves with purpose, dodging flames and debris, searching for survivors and inspecting pods carefully.
Identifies and reacts emotionally to the surviving woman in the pod, demonstrating focus and clarity despite chaos.
Stumbles on amid a fuel explosion and continues tracking pods even as the area becomes increasingly dangerous.
Shows confused and amazed internal reaction, but does not freeze or retreat.
Unable to prevent drones from firing on the ship's pods, no evidence of effective countermeasures or mitigation.
Moves between the Drone and the Pod with the woman, shielding the Pod from gunfire despite danger to himself.
Commands the woman (or others) to get out of danger, showing concern for their safety.
Exhibits desperation and bravery facing almost certain death to protect others.
Moves between the Drone and the Pod to physically shield the woman, showing bravery and quick situational awareness.
Un-shoulders his weapon and fires at the Drone, successfully forcing it to retreat temporarily despite being outmatched.
Commands the woman to leave, showing leadership and control in a dangerous moment.
Touches the glass protecting the sleeping woman gently, wiping away soot and dust.
Urgently insists Victoria open the glass doors and helps haul the pod inside to protect the woman.
Expresses frustration and concern about the drones targeting the woman and other survivors, confronting Victoria's calm rationalization.
Heaves the Delta Pod onto the carrier using armatures designed for damaged drones, effectively securing it for transport.
Quickly reacts to the situation by hauling the Pod into the house despite harsh wind conditions, demonstrating decisive physical capability.
Challenges Victoria's rationalizations firmly and questions protocol, showing confident understanding of the danger and stakes involved.
Moves quickly to help the woman and assists in getting her out of the damaged Pod despite risk.
Shows anger when Victoria insists on reporting, but uses it strategically to expose drone attacks on humans.
Physically supports and comforts the woman as she struggles, kneeling beside her and putting a hand on her shoulder.
Takes charge promptly to get the cutter and equipment, skillfully uses the cutter to open the pod seal, and carefully assists the woman out, demonstrating technical skill and presence of mind.
Shows situational awareness by planning to report not only the pod damage but also the drone attacks, indicating strategic thinking.
Instinctively attempts to physically support the woman when she is violently ill, despite Victoria advising against it, showing a small lapse in medical procedure knowledge or control.
Kneels beside the disoriented woman and puts a hand on her shoulder to comfort her.
Catches the exhausted woman when she slumps into unconsciousness.
Holds the unconscious woman like a child under the shower, sharing a caring and protective moment.
Responds with 'I know' when told the woman needs to be moved and cleaned up, suggesting acceptance but no further expression of empathy or initiative.
Has no answer when asked by Victoria 'What's going on?'
Kneels beside the unconscious woman, puts a reassuring hand on her shoulder, catches her when she slumps unconscious.
Acknowledges the need to get the woman up to the Tet and responds to Victoria's concerns with 'I know,' showing awareness of the situation.
Shakes his head and admits he has no idea what is going on when the glass door slides open.
Nods but won't look at Victoria; deep in thought; insists on knowing why about the Greek funeral vase, showing some personal attachment and contemplation.
Watches over Julia while she sleeps in the infirmary, showing quiet concern and tenderness.
Repaired and activates a drone, which then fires off menacingly, but Jack shows no aggression or hostility, just stares at it.
Wants to share a personal memory or feeling with Victoria, indicating a desire for connection.
Repairs and reactivates Drone 166, demonstrating technical skill and calmness when faced with a potentially dangerous machine.
Stares at Julia with concern and hesitation, showing emotional vulnerability rather than decisive action.
Initiates an important personal conversation with Victoria, indicating thoughtful reflection and intention to communicate.
Watches Victoria swim laps but turns away rather than engaging with her.
Does not respond when Victoria desperately pleads and shows affection, creating emotional distance.
Lies down silently near Victoria, both showing vulnerability in silence.
Speaks gently to Julia about the beauty of the new home and seeks to engage her feelings with genuine interest.
Observes Julia silently crying alone but approaches quietly without intrusion.
Asks direct questions but does not show impatience or frustration when Julia lies about her memory.
Asks Julia thoughtful questions, attempts to engage her emotionally, notices details like her tears, and responds sensitively.
Leaves Victoria sleeping to quietly leave the bed and move around, showing awareness and restraint.
Repeatedly experiences the same dream but uses it as a prompt for reflection rather than ignoring it.
Laughs lightly at Julia's caution, showing informal friendliness.
Shakes Julia's hand when thanked, accepting gratitude awkwardly.
Answers questions openly about the ship and situation without hostility.
Withholds who sent the transmission, saying 'I don't know'—neutral but possibly evasive.
Recognizes the old pre-war ship as something unique despite never having seen it before.
Confidently assures Julia that help will arrive from the Tet soon and understands the situation well.
Laughs at Julia's caution about going down to find the flight recorder, implying he is experienced with danger and capable.
Reveals he flies the Bubbleship and interacts confidently with Julia.
Reassures Victoria he will be back before she needs to make her report, showing consideration for her concerns.
Dismisses Victoria's worries and switches off the comm abruptly, ignoring her attempt to understand.
Encourages Julia's desire to see the wreck and secure items, validating her feelings and supporting her.
Confidently assures Victoria they will return before Tet rise and dismisses her concerns about safety.
Successfully recovers the ship from a dangerous dive and sets course across the altered earth.
Switches off communication with Victoria despite her concerns, showing control but potentially risky dismissal of input.
Acknowledges harsh realities of their situation with a bit of dry humor and honesty.
Calmly explains their roles and situation to Julia, showing tolerance and straightforwardness.
Shrugs off the grim truth about nuking the planet, showing a lack of emotional expression.
Explains the situation about the Scavs and the aftermath confidently and clearly.
Admits to being just a 'tech' who fixes things, implying limited skills compared to others (like Vika).
Tries to calm Julia down by saying 'Look, it doesn't matter' when she is upset about missing items from the wreckage.
Half watches Julia while tracking the periphery with his weapon slung low, showing some readiness to protect.
Half watches Julia while also tracking the periphery with his weapon slung low, indicating situational awareness and a protective stance.
Tries to reason with Julia by suggesting staying close, but fails to effectively support or provide a solution when the flight recorder is missing.
Expresses apology to Julia when caught staring at her.
Urgently responds to Victoria's warning about approaching aliens.
Prioritizes Julia's safety by fighting off attackers and commands escape.
Stares at Julia suspiciously, questioning her identity.
Struggles physically against Scavs and is knocked down by a giant Scav's club.
Remains conscious and alert enough to observe surroundings while tied to sled and notices Julia being unconscious, showing situational awareness.
Lies protectively close to Julia who is unconscious, trying to orient himself.
Tenses and shows wariness when confronted by Beech, indicating mistrust.
Raises his head and tries to orient despite blood-encrusted eyes and darkness, actively scanning the environment.
Tenses upon seeing the figure and cautiously assesses the situation, showing alertness and awareness.
Asks who the figure is and where they are, indicating confusion about the situation.
Moves to protect Julia when she groans and wakes up under harsh light.
Does not respond when Beech accuses him of suspicion or collaboration.
Expresses hostility toward Scavs by blaming them for taking everything from 'us'.
Moves quickly to protect Julia as she is roused by the lights, and tracks many armed humans around, indicating situational awareness and protective instinct.
Does not respond to Beech's accusation of collaboration, possibly showing restraint or confusion but a missed chance to assert or clarify.
Cannot immediately process the revelation that the Scavs are human, showing some initial confusion or difficulty adapting to new information.
Almost got himself blown up protecting Julia, then calms and protects her when she wakes up frightened.
Attempts to reassure with a general statement 'Anyone would have...'
Offers Julia and others food once they get to the Tet, suggesting provision and care for others.
Grabs Julia to protect her and calms her down during a sudden scare.
Almost got blown to bits protecting Julia, showing willingness to take risks but also close to failure.
Follows Beech cautiously through an unknown environment, showing prudence and awareness.
Answers Beech's questions factually and confidently about food availability, showing knowledge and some confidence.
Jack stops momentarily, absorbed by the art and books, showing a capacity for appreciation and introspection.
No explicit action of kindness or trustworthiness shown in excerpt; mostly neutral interaction.
Survives in dangerous radiation zones no one else patrols, showing ability to endure extreme conditions.
Loses contact for six hours, prompting concern and suspicion about his whereabouts.

Shares history about the Tet's construction and the fate of those who refused to go, indicating awareness of high stakes and consequences but remains stern and somewhat distant in interaction with Julia.
Calmly assesses situation and recalls critical history about the Tet's construction and consequences of leaders refusing to evacuate, demonstrating awareness and understanding of risks.
Remains silent and does not engage with Julia when she tries to speak, potentially indicating poor communication or lack of teamwork.
Reassures Victoria over radio, 'It'll be fine. Trust me.' and promises to be home for breakfast.
Calmly reassures Victoria over radio despite danger, showing confidence and control.
Takes a risk by venturing far into border territory (over five clicks from beacons), which may indicate recklessness or calculated risk taking depending on context.
Refuses to share personal memories and gets angry when pressed about his past.
Reluctantly engages in conversation and hesitates to speak about sensitive family details.
Rejects evidence and gets angry instead of calmly processing information about the mission and the bomb.
Confidently denies Beech's attempts to unsettle him with personal questions, showing emotional control under pressure.
Fails to notice or acknowledge key evidence such as the empty sleep pods, implying a lapse in careful observation.
Refuses to believe Beech and Julia’s accusations, shows denial and mistrust.
Tries to appeal to Julia for support.
Stares at the name plate on the pod, indicating recognition but initial confusion at his past involvement.
Rejects the accusation and information given by Beech and Julia, showing denial rather than critical engagement.
Attempts to reason about the existence of people up there and the situation, suggesting some presence of critical thinking.
Becomes speechless after Beech tells him the truth about the war loss, indicating emotional or cognitive overload.
Is identified as someone with technical skills able to program alien technology, implying a high level of competence inherent in him.
Refuses to program the Drone to self-activate and kill, arguing it will kill indiscriminately.
Stares down an armed enemy without backing down to protect Julia and challenge orders.
Shows concern for others by warning that activating the Drone will lead to more danger for everyone.
Stares down Sykes while he is threatened with a weapon, calmly asserting control over the situation.
Refuses to comply with Beech's order to program the Drone to return to the Tet and cause destruction, showing independent judgment.
Explains logically and confidently the danger posed by the Drone if it returns, demonstrating understanding of the situation.
Attempts to protect Beech by offering to send a signal to call off the Drone search, aiming to keep him safe.
Ignores Beech's attempt to share potentially important information and speeds away quickly without listening.
Maintains focus on helping Beech despite Sykes's distrust and interruptions.
Calmly takes control of a dangerous situation by deciding to send a signal to call off a lethal search party, showing proactive problem-solving.
Successfully powers up and rides a motorcycle under pressure, demonstrating technical skill and composure.
Ignores a critical new piece of information from Beech about the radiation zones and potential world truths before fleeing hastily.
Allows Julia to enjoy the beautiful vistas on the bike, silently sharing the moment with her.
Leaves the dead electric bike without complaint and moves forward, focused on the mission.
Explains to Julia the history of the Resource Gatherer wreck and the misunderstanding about the war with the Scavs, sharing insight without hostility.
Continues working on the repeater while Julia watches quietly, maintaining professional focus but not engaging warmly.
Pilots the electric bike skillfully across difficult terrain, navigates a challenging landscape, and quickly adapts when the bike runs out of charge by continuing on foot.
Checks and works on old, difficult technology (the repeater) to communicate with the bubbleship, showing technical skill and persistence.
Leaves the bike where it lies without attempting to repair or retrieve it, potentially indicating a lack of caution or planning.
Shares a sweet and tender conversation with Victoria on a recording, showing affectionate and caring interaction.
Avoids answering Julia's question and refuses to turn in the old man despite potential danger, indicating reticence and possibly secretive behavior.
Engages in a sweet, confident banter with Victoria in a recording, showing personal connection alongside work.
Is silent and avoids meeting Julia's eyes when discussing a dangerous situation, indicating hesitation or uncertainty.
Responds defensively to Julia's attempts to connect over past shared experiences and memories, shutting down conversation.
Expresses confusion and agitation when confronted with his lost memories and past, showing vulnerability.
Closes emotional distance with Julia, shares intimate moments and nostalgic memories, proposes marriage thoughtfully through a personalized gesture.
Tries to break away from Julia's kiss showing confusion and guilt, indicating internal conflict or reservation.
Uses a telescope skillfully to guide Julia's attention to a hidden marriage proposal on a billboard, demonstrating planning and thoughtful execution.
Feels confused and guilty when the Bubbleship arrives, tries to break away from Julia but does not assert control over the situation.
Contacts Victoria to reassure her and instruct her not to report to Mission until he returns.
Maintains a tense silence with Julia during piloting the ship.
Pilots the ship and checks readouts calmly under tense conditions, contacts Victoria directly, attempts to control the communication despite silence from Mission.
Orders Victoria not to report to Mission until he returns, showing calculated caution and command presence.
Fails to get a response from Victoria and Mission control but continues to update his status, showing persistence and protocol adherence.
Explains to Victoria that the enemy Scavs are humans like them and that the war is a huge mistake.
Remains silent when Victoria accuses him of never loving her.
Admits to Victoria that Julia was his wife, showing sincerity and emotional openness.
Steps out near the garden to assess the damage, demonstrates situational awareness of the aftermath.
Attempts to explain the Scavs as humans and the war as a mistake, showing understanding and insight.
Remains silent when accused by Victoria of never loving her, indicating difficulty in emotional communication or decisiveness.
Broken and emotionally vulnerable when discussing his past relationship, showing a lapse in confident or controlled behavior.
Accepts Victoria's betrayal quickly, tries to convince her to come with him to survive.
Lunges forward abruptly when Victoria steps back, showing intense emotion.
Falls to his knees in shock after Victoria falls, showing vulnerability and emotional response.
Enters Victoria's private control station without permission (trespasses).
Speaks directly to the Tet about Victoria's death, shows insistence on her being dead.
Quickly accepts Victoria's betrayal without hesitation and tries to persuade her to come with him.
Immediately enters Victoria's control station without permission, assesses the environment for clues like the coffee cup and the wavelength on the monitor.
Initiates communication directly with the Tet despite never having done so before, and firmly insists on Victoria's death.
Reacted emotionally and with shock (falls to knees), showing momentary vulnerability in a crisis.
Expresses strong desire to communicate and hear a voice, showing emotional vulnerability.
Responds to Julia's doubt with seriousness rather than dismissiveness, indicating respect and consideration.
Evades pursuit by spinning the ship and maneuvers skillfully to collide mid-air, taking down two drones.
Stays calm and in control during the ship tumbling end over end and continues to track the last drone.
Fails when his remaining weapon is dead and the ship canopy is cracked by enemy fire.
Checks on Julia's well-being after a dangerous event by asking 'You okay?'
Focuses on piloting and evading threats without showing overt emotional support beyond a brief check-in
Stays on the controls while the ship tumbles and tracks the last Drone closing from above.
Forces the Drone and ship to turn, uses Drone 166's cannon effectively to destroy the last Drone.
Punches the throttle and expertly pulls up just clearing the ridge, avoiding a crash despite damage and pursuit.
Acknowledges Julia's condition and keeps focus, turns the ship north despite shaking and smoking, showing calm under pressure.
Notices radiation warning and reacts by making adjustments to increase speed despite the system strain.
Attempts to use the extra boost from the bar gauge despite a malfunctioning gauge and dangerous radiation warnings.
Hits the dirt quickly as the bubbleship screams overhead and lands, demonstrating situational awareness and caution.
Attempts to use binoculars but finds the lenses shattered, showing he is prepared with tools but circumstances limit effectiveness.
Realizes what the repairman is doing and runs to stop him despite the growing sandstorm, showing quick recognition and decisive action.
Yells 'Hey! Stop! Don't touch that Drone!' but his words are eaten by the wind and sand, indicating a lack of ability to effectively communicate urgency under environmental conditions.
Stares back in utter astonishment when the repairman is revealed to be himself, showing a moment of surprise and possible confusion.
Rushes forward to stop Jack 2 from aiming his rifle at Julia, showing protective instinct.
Pleads with Jack 2 to understand that they are both drones, attempts to communicate urgently.
Uses choke-hold to subdue Jack 2 but immediately shows concern as he squeezes and then lets go when Jack 2 goes limp.
Engages in violent combat with himself (Jack 2) including struggle over weapon and physical blows.
Recognizes the truth about himself and the clone quickly, showing insight and understanding of the situation.
Attempts to de-escalate and reason with Jack 2 during their fight by telling him they are both drones, using calm and control.
Effectively uses combat skills to subdue Jack 2 despite their equal training and physical strength.
Urgently warns Julia to stay back, showing protective awareness and situational control.
Accepts Julia's fear and terror of him without anger or resentment.
Carries injured Julia to shelter against her will to ensure her safety.
Promises Julia "I'll be back for you," showing concern and commitment.
Uses empty words "One, Two, Three. Jack Harper" when alone, indicating possible emotional detachment or mechanical behavior.
Carries injured Julia to shelter despite her pushing him away, showing calm acceptance of her fear and focus on her safety.
Looks around Bubbleship 2 carefully, recognizing details and initiating controls confidently before takeoff.
Realizes he can and must return for Julia, demonstrating situational awareness and planning.
Kisses Victoria gently and lovingly, insists on taking care of his wound himself to avoid burdening her.
His heartbroken stare at Victoria when she asks about his injury, showing emotional openness.
Marvels at Victoria's beauty and the simplicity of life around him, indicating appreciation and connection.
Maintains composure despite damaged environmental suit and recent injury, downplays situation as 'just a bit of a dust up'
Insists on personally retrieving the healant despite being injured, showing initiative and responsibility
Shows emotional vulnerability and hesitation ('stares at her, heartbroken'), momentarily distracted from task
Stares at the brand-new, unworn picture of he and Victoria, showing a moment of silent connection.
Notices the subtle personal touches in the living area, observing with a new appreciation and sensitivity.
Says 'Good bye...' reluctantly before leaving, indicating a small, sincere farewell despite emotional distance.
Pulls Julia into his lap and tends to her wound despite her unconscious state, showing care and concern.
Avoids acknowledging Victoria 2’s puzzled reaction and leaves without a proper goodbye.
Notices small details and differences in his environment that others overlook, showing observational skill.
Pulls Julia into his lap and exposes the wound to assess her condition, showing quick and practical medical response.
Responds simply and calmly with ‘Good bye...’ to Victoria 2 when she mentions he didn’t say goodbye, indicating measured emotional control and confident communication.
Gently treats Julia's wound despite her screams.
Avoids eye contact, seems ashamed and scared of himself.
Expresses vulnerable hope about living peacefully with Julia ('we' statement).
Applies healant carefully to Julia's wound and activates it, facilitating the healing process.
Successfully pilots the Bubbleship through the sky, maintaining focus despite Julia's gaze.
Does not engage emotionally with Julia, avoiding eye contact due to fear and shame, possibly indicating internal struggle but not lack of skill.
Smiles at the fish nibbling algae.
Allows Julia to hold his hand during flight.
Tells Julia to stay behind while he enters the dangerous Raven Rock.
Pushes the projector over, interrupting the viewing of war footage depicting alien soldiers identical to him killing a cameraman.
Engages in a candid conversation with Beech about their situation and his role as a weapon, showing openness and acceptance.
Pushes the projector over to show war footage and engages with Beech about the situation.
Confirms his role as a weapon in the war, showing self-awareness and acceptance of his function.
Asks why Beech didn't tell him the full truth, indicating critical thinking and seeking understanding.
Kneels in front of Beech after his death and gently closes his eyes, shows respect and care.
Hauls a bomb into the delta sleep pod for Julia, showing practical support and willingness to help.
Shares an emotionally charged kiss with Julia, indicating sincerity and deep connection.
Removes the flight recorder from Beech's arms after his death, showing awareness and presence of mind.
Successfully hauls and installs a cylindrical bomb into a Delta Sleep Pod, indicating technical skill and capability.
His silence in response to Julia's plea to bring her to 'it' before nodding, suggests confidence and decision-making under pressure.
Puts his hand on the glass facing Julia's hand and watches her fear and vulnerability as she falls asleep in the gas chamber, quietly telling her 'Dream about us.'
Calmly initiates the sleep pod’s gas release for Julia despite emotional difficulty, showing control and decisiveness under pressure.
Efficiently loads the sleep pod onto the drone-carrier in harsh windy conditions, demonstrating practical skill and purposeful focus.
Pilots the Bubbleship confidently, managing flight controls and monitoring recorded audio from deep space, indicating technical knowledge and composure.
Stares quietly at Julia sleeping without immediate intervention, indicating emotional conflict affecting his ability to act, suggesting a minor hesitance in critical moments.
Engages cooperatively with Mission Control and The Tet, seeks to deliver the survivor, emphasizes team effectiveness.
Mocks original Victoria's caution by sarcastically stating one hundred kilometers is the best distance to know something.
Decides to convert his ship to space mode without prior authorization but justifies it by his mission to deliver the survivor, showing initiative and confidence under pressure.
Engages in a thoughtful dialogue questioning the unknown object's nature and the proper approach distance, indicating critical thinking and awareness of mission parameters.
Mocks the standard procedure sarcastically, implying skeptical attitude toward mission rules without fully dismissing them, which could indicate confidence but also borderline recklessness.
Smiles relieved when Original Victoria agrees with him.
Touches the glass of Julia's Delta Sleep Pod with a reassuring gesture before leaving.
Decides independently to approach the Tet despite mission orders to maintain distance.
Pushes the shuttle forward slightly against orders to seize a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to make contact with the Tet.
Disregards direct mission orders, showing impulsiveness by donning a spacesuit and preparing to take unauthorized action.
Smiles at Victoria, suggests taking a photo together to 'make history.'
Speaks kindly to his bobblehead, admitting fear ('I'm scared too').
Calmly flies his ship into the massive alien structure following instructions precisely, showing skill and confidence.
Smiles and acknowledges fear but continues with mission, showing emotional control paired with professional focus.
Touches a control and confidently challenges the Tet by saying it made a mistake, demonstrates curiosity and initiative.
Shares a story about courage and dying well to Tet, showing openness and a desire to connect.
Aggressively attacks the large doors with his ship, demonstrating combativeness rather than kindness.
Guns his ship at the large doors, opening them with canons and flying through an imploding door to enter the vast internal chamber of the Tet.
Flies his ship aggressively despite drone fire, even as the ship is hit multiple times, demonstrating determination and skill under fire.
Keeps telling the story of Horatius and encourages dying well even while under attack, showing mental resilience and focus.
Loses control of the ship after the engine is hit, crashing halfway through a wall and shattering the canopy, resulting in injury and loss of control.
Despite being badly wounded, Jack stumbles out and drags the pod off the carrier, showing perseverance and physical capability after injury.
Drags the pod off the carrier despite being badly wounded, showing determination.
Laughs morbidly upon seeing clones of himself and Victoria, indicating a dark, possibly cynical attitude.
Faltering and showing real fear when reciting, revealing vulnerability and sincerity.
Drags himself out wounded and removes a pod from the carrier despite injury.
Tracks the walls carefully to locate pods with clones inside.
Laughs morbidly at the discovery of clones and Beech's body with the warhead.
Starts reciting a phrase but falters due to fear as drones approach.
Closes his eyes and recites a powerful speech without embellishment, suggesting focus and mental preparation under pressure.
Yells to be heard and pounds the trigger with his fist as drones swarm him, showing decisive and confident action in a critical moment.
Successfully triggers the destruction of the Tet from inside, leading to a massive explosion that disables enemy drones and resources, demonstrating effective and skillful sabotage.
Has scavenged and built a functional home with cultivated ground and flowers, creating a safe environment.
Returns after a long journey, prompting Julia to warmly include the child by calling Jack 'your father' and inviting them to pick him up.
Turns the Grotto into a functional homestead with cultivated ground, flowering plants, and a solar array, effectively using scavenged materials.
Travels a long distance wearing wrecked remains of a worksuit and scavenged boots, showing persistence but potentially lacking access to better gear.
